column4: dist-upgrade is required to install new packages. upgrade only upgrades existing packages.
check upgrade manager todays updates say something like: "some packages could not be upgraded as this requires to dist upgrade" then a button below appears offering to upgrade distribution
I'm on Feisty so haven't seen this... but I'm sure pressing "yes" will get you there :)
yes but, this looks a bit strange...
do a "sudo apt-get dist upgrade" and pastebin it... don't press Y so I can take a looksee :)
as feisty is not even beta yet, and it has happened to me in 2 different machines already
you sure thats the command? maybe you mean apt-get update?
what to do if upgrade-manager doesn't show the upgrade button?
warning: could not initiate dbus (update-manager loads, but no upgrade button appears. It worked in 0.45.2, now with 0.45.3 it does't.
Same deal... Should i try downgrading update-manager indo 0.45.2?
